title: Cryptocurrency Wallet & Exchange System
description: Threat model derived from OWASP-style diagram covering a desktop wallet, mobile app, exchange backend/API, and blockchain interaction.

scope.title: Electrum Wallet + Exchange + Blockchain Integration
scope.description: All components shown in the diagram, including wallet, exchange backend & API, mobile app, and blockchain integration. Out of scope: user’s OS, hardware device, third-party dependencies not shown.

description: A data flow diagram of a cryptocurrency wallet submitted by Jonathan Marcil to the OWASP Threat Model Cookbook.

diagrams.title: Cryptocurrency Wallet DFD
diagrams.source:
flowchart LR; User --> GUI; User --> Browser; User --> MobileApp; GUI --> Daemon; Daemon -- "HTTP JSON-RPC (localhost random port)" --> Browser; Daemon -- "TCP+SSL 50002
JSON-RPC" --> ElectrumX; ElectrumX -- SPV --> Blockchain; Browser -- HTTPS --> ExchangeWeb; ExchangeWeb -- HTTPS --> ExchangeBackend; ExchangeBackend -- HTTP --> ExchangeAPI; ExchangeAPI --> MongoDB; ExchangeAPI --> BlockchainIntegration; BlockchainIntegration --> Blockchain; MobileApp -- HTTPS --> ExchangeAPI; TradingBot -- "WebSocket Secure" --> ExchangeAPI; ExchangeBackend -. "MySQL user & config" .-> ExchangeBackend.

trust_zones.name: User Device
trust_zones.description: The user's device, including the wallet, browser, and mobile app.

trust_zones.name: Exchange Internal
trust_zones.description: The internal network of the exchange.

trust_boundaries.description: Boundary for mobile app communicating over Internet.
Boundary at the exchange API/website ingress.
Boundary when exchange backend or blockchain integration module interacts with blockchain network.

actors.name: End-User
actors.description: A legitimate user interacting via wallet GUI, browser or mobile app.

components.name: Electrum Wallet Daemon
components.description: Local wallet backend process exposing HTTP JSON-RPC on localhost.

components.name: ElectrumX Server
components.description: Third-party SPV server that wallets connect to for blockchain data.

components.name: Web Browser
components.description: Browser used to access exchange website or interact with local wallet UI.

components.name: Mobile App
components.description: Mobile application variant for wallet or exchange interaction.

components.name: Exchange Website (Front-end)
components.description: Frontend served to users, interacts with backend via HTTPS.

components.name: Exchange Backend
components.description: Backend server handling business logic, config, user data, etc.

components.name: Exchange API (Node.js)
components.description: API server providing programmatic access to exchange functions (e.g. trading, account data).

components.name: Trading Bot
components.description: User-run bot using API keys to interact with Exchange API (via secure WebSocket).

components.name: Blockchain Integration Module
components.description: Module that interfaces with blockchain network to read/write blockchain state.

data_stores.name: Wallet File
data_stores.description: Local wallet file stored at rest (should be encrypted).

data_stores.name: MySQL (User & Config)
data_stores.description: Relational database storing user accounts and configuration.

data_stores.name: MongoDB (Exchange Data)
data_stores.description: NoSQL store used by Exchange API for trading data, logs, etc.

data_flows.description: Local IPC/loopback HTTP JSON-RPC calls from GUI to daemon.
Daemon connects to ElectrumX over Internet for SPV / blockchain queries.
HTTPS requests to exchange website frontend.
HTTPS requests from front-end to backend.
Secure WebSocket (or HTTPS) API calls to exchange API.
Backend writes/reads operational data to MongoDB.
Backend triggers blockchain read/write operations via integration module.
Blockchain integration module interacts with public blockchain network.

assumptions.description: TLS terminates at load balancer; all front-end ↔ backend communication uses HTTPS.
User device is not compromised and wallet file encryption (if enabled) protects against local unauthorized access.

threat_personas.name: Remote External Attacker
threat_personas.description: An unauthenticated adversary on the public Internet trying to intercept or spoof communications.

threats.title: No authentication for wallet-to-SPV server connection
threats.description: The wallet daemon connects to the SPV server over TCP+SSL without authentication, allowing a man-in-the-middle or rogue SPV server to feed false blockchain data.

controls.title: Encrypt wallet file at rest
controls.description: Ensure the local wallet file is encrypted to protect against unauthorized access if device is compromised.

controls.symbolic_name: Use read-only API key for trading bot
controls.title: Use read-only API key for trading bot
controls.description: Restrict API key used by trading bot to read-only permissions to minimize risk of unauthorized operations.

controls.symbolic_name: Add authentication and host-header validation for exchange API and backend
controls.title: Add authentication and host-header validation for exchange API and backend
controls.description: Require proper authentication, validate host headers, and enforce TLS to prevent unauthorized or spoofed requests.
